title: Round (square!?) type
content:
I all,

I’m devoloping a logo and I need help in founding a Round (square!?) type.  
I made a first draft with the Helvetica. What I need is sugestions of type with the square shape but not square. Please see the image (i made a square around some letters) to better understanding.  
If further explanation is needed please let me know.

António

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_5086.jpg)

 [‹ clean typeface suggestion for business/lifestyle magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/typophile.com/node/39468 "Go to previous forum topic") [Somebody Help! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/typophile.com/node/39481 "Go to next forum topic")
author: afonseca1974

comments.content:
If you are meaning a Sans Serif that follows the same classic feel as Helvetica:

A more “square” Sans Serif could be [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/univers_lt_std_65_bold_ot/), but it is not exactly “squared”. It appears more “square” when compared to Futura or Helvetica. The “square” parts of it are the counters and the bowls, but still, like I said is only has the subtle nuance of “square-ness.”  
Also, [DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_din_ot_bold/) might fall into this as well.

If you are looking for a square typeface might want to try:

[Square Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/square_721_bold/)  
 [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/eurostile_lt_std_bold_ot/)

These faces are as far as you can get before moving into perfectly geometric characters or “techno” fonts (I hate using that term as a classification):

[Agency](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/agency_bold/)  
 [Bank Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner_flake/bank_gothic_medium/) - small caps
That almost made me poop my pants. In a really good way.

António - I think what you’re looking for a class of [sans serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/typophile.com/wiki/sans%252Bserif) called [geometric sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/typophile.com/wiki/geometric%252Bsans). These are typefaces based on a perfect circle.

[Futura](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/futura_std_ot/)  
 [ITC Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014051733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/itc_avant_garde_gothic_1_std/)

Hi all!  
Thanks for the comments.  
Stephen is rigth. I’m looking for a class of sans serif called geometric sans.  
Other sugestions after Futura and ITC Avant Garde Gothic are welcome!

António

Sorry, I perceived as the other way around. I thought he wanted a more square feel. haha.

My bad.

I thought the logo in helvetica looked great...but I guess I’m just doomed to be addited. Oh well. but then again you can’t go wrong with futura.

Chase Langdon
